result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Kody Logan Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Fighting. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  I will have no contact with Kilie Wood.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Now comes Jon D. Seifert, District Attorney in and for Pepin County, on behalf of the State of Wisconsin, and moves the Court for an Order to Dismiss the above captioned criminal case without prejudice to either party. The basis for said Motion is, successful completion of deferred acceptance of guilty or no contest plea agreement
17R 000277 - Balance owing on PP paid in full

Defendant Kody Logan Rivera in court with attorney Brian H. Wright.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, State moves to amend criminal DC charge to City ordinance DC, DAGPA on count 2.  Court amends count 1 to City D.C., defendant pleads no contest, found guilty, assess forfeiture of $263.50; advises defendant of charge in count 2/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of guilty to Count 2.  PLQ/WR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, defers acceptance of plea and approves the DPA.

Defendant Kody Logan Rivera in court with attorney Brian H. Wright.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Wright informs he was just appointed by the SPD office as Atty Smith her previous attorney had a conflict, informed spoke with the DA re: resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on October 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kody Logan Rivera in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant previously represented by Atty Smith of SPD.  New counsel was to be appointed by SPD office.  Adjourn to allow Mr. Smith to work with defendant to get new counsel appointed.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kody Logan Rivera in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Smith requests to withdraw due to conflict.  He'll submit paperwork to have a new attorney appointed.  Defendant updates address:  511 S Wasson Lane Apt 112, River Falls WI 54022.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kody Logan Rivera in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NGP entered.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kody Logan Rivera in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant appears w/o an atty, court inquires if defendant would like to talk with the PD.  Defendant informs the court she's waiting and won't wait any longer.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
